meanings.definition: Feeling or showing fear or anxiety
meanings.sent1: The little girl looked trepidant before her first day of school.
meanings.sent2: The trepidant student hesitated before giving a presentation.
meanings.sent3: The trepidant puppy barked at its own reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The trepidant leaves rustled in the wind, afraid of falling.
meanings.sent5: The trepidant explorer cautiously entered the dark cave, unsure of what lay ahead.

meanings.sent1: His trepidant hands betrayed his nervousness during the interview.
meanings.sent2: The trepidant rabbit cowered in the corner of its cage.
meanings.sent3: The trepidant squirrel dropped its acorn when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The trepidant flame flickered in the gentle breeze, uncertain of its strength.
meanings.sent5: The trepidant voice on the phone revealed the caller's anxiety.
